content: monolingualism creates my solitude, my ipseity.
monolingualism in which I draw my breath is, for me, my element: absolute habitat, preceded me
cannot challenge indisputable monolingualism in me, except by testifying to its omnipresence in me
language will never be mine
common language: “Yes, I only have one language, yet it is not mine” > the impossible, inhabiting logical contradiction [suffer & take pleasure in this statement]
this inexhaustible solipsism is myself before me, lastingly (A demeure)
lying by confessing the lie of not possessing language
puerile weapon, accuse Derrida of being: skeptic, relativist, nihilist
install myself resolutely in the very instant of performative contradiction
they have a short memory = out of training
division, why one writes and how one dreams of writing, place of jealousy, divided btwn vengeance and resentment.
before any memory writing destines itself to anamnesia
“take your word for it:” good faith, credit to the Other
all these problems of identity, as we foolishly say
law: first condition of madness
law of translation: “We never speak one language, we only speak one.” Law itself as translation.
Aristotle’s model: the “most” this, the “best” that: paradigmatic example
hyphen is never enough to conceal protests, anger, weapons, bombs
power this ‘alien’ [Oedipus] holds over ‘aliens’: innermost secret, sepulture, in exchange for salvation of city, which he refuses his daughters (refuses them a just ‘work of mourning’)
dogmatism of identity, preceded by ipseity?
“disorder of identity”:  more threatened and artificial than ever
ipseity: before “I” the “I can” [semantic chain: hospes, hostis, hosti-pet, posis, potest…]
artifice and precariousness of citizenship appear better when it is inscribed in memory as a recent acquisition
possession and language
language and possession
disorder of identity: does it favor or inhibit anamnesia? heighten desire for memory? both! exhausts us, point of losing our breath, our minds
alone in a genre [particular] that becomes a universal example, exemplarity of host as hostage: “universal hostage”
narrative: space of relation
narrative: space of relation
one can testify only to the unbelievable: that which can only be believed [credited] > even false testimony presupposes this unbelievable testimony
universal value of “I only have one language, it is not mine:” immanent structure of promise or desire, expectation w/out horizon
monolingual solipsism never belonging, never property, power of mastery, never pure “ipseity” (hospitality or hostility)

threatening & threatened promise, monolingualism & tautology, impossibility of metalanguage, but there are effects of metalanguage: at the horizon, spectral, infinitely desirable, allows the mirage of another language to tremble
terror inside language; p. 24 nothing but jealousy unleashed, “[language] takes its revenge at the heart of the law”
master does not have exclusive possession of anything, only possesses, usurps unnaturally, rapes, colonizes through “unnatural process of politico-phantasmatic constructions”
no absolute appropriation/reappropriation because no natural property of language, only appropriative madness, jealousy without appropriation [see p. 63]
no absolute appropriation/reappropriation because no natural property of language, only appropriative madness, jealousy without appropriation [see p. 63]
master thinks his “speech act” works
when hospitality auto-limits itself into a law [fire’s reflection]
neither lack nor alienation, alienation without alienation > origin of our responsibility, structures peculiar property of language
declare under oath: “I have only one language and it is not mine”
abiding “alienation” appears constitutive like lack, but it isn’t lack
dissemination, form of thinking of the unique, not the plural
differance in relation to universal necessity (trauma, lesion), reality, scope of any férance
The inability to reduce spectral phantasmaticity does not alleviate political and historical terror
body of the martyr, body of language and writing, marks as scars, Derrida a Franco-Maghrebian martyr

mark, re-mark, experience of language, what gives rise to articulation btwn ontological universality & testimonial singularity of martyred existence > universal destiny assigns us to a single language which cannot be appropriated
“only the interminable and indefinitely phantasmatic process of identification endures”
“identificatory modalities: all the poles of imaginary projection in social culture”
people must yield to the homo-hegemony of dominant languages, the languages of masters, capital, machine
amnesia is active, dynamic, something other than mere forgetfulness
double interdict: can’t speak the other language, can’t speak the one language
surging wave [déferlment déchainé] of anamnesia that the double interdict unleashed > invent one’s language and “I” at the same time [see p. 70 on autobiography]
but interdict wrong word, never enacted as law, no, it’s the fundamental interdiction, the absolute interdiction [TACT]
loves the word grievance
inscription of self in the forbidden language
“the loving and jealous vengeance of a new work of training [dressage], restore and reinvent language”

to those who celebrate “fraternity”: “listen, pay attention, you must wake up and leave…your mother tongue will no longer even respond to you, do not believe so quickly that you are a people, cease listening without protest to those who say ‘listen’….”
“sovereign establishment (mise en demeure souveraine) [sovereign summons]… disguised under alibis of ‘universal’ humanism”
all culture is originally colonial: unilateral imposition of “politics” of language
I will be accused of confusing it all, of course I am not; p. 41 each of my favorite languages
[re: barred access to Arabic, Berber] “the inscription of this limit could not leave traces”: multiply symptoms of a fascination
place of fantasy (France): infinite distance or incommensurable proximity (invisible and radiant hearth)
sea is lacking there [that is, in Paris, which lacks distancing of being-elsewhere, compared to Algeria]
doesn’t like certain accents; [on his demand for purity of language] it simply exposes me to suffering when someone, who can be myself, happens to fall short of it
I always surrender myself to language: give credit to that which is to come (as opposed to the given)

someone in Derrida flatters himself to understand a domineering murmur beyond grammar, bow to a more hidden rule, last will of language entrusted only to me [see p. 49], last heir of French language: play the role of hero-martyr-pioneer-outlaw-legislator [Nietzsche]
I try to impart a tone, rhythm
hyperbolic taste for purity of language, an incorrigible hyperbolite: I always exaggerate.
Derrida risks infantile presumptuousness of infantile allegations (“I am the last Jew”) to be honest: “I always tell the truth, you can believe me.”
hyperbole is Plato’s word: excess beyond excess > impregnable, epekeina tes ousias

appropriate formidable, enviable and inaccessible words, domesticate, coax (amadouer), love by setting on fire, perhaps destroy, mark, transform, graft at the fire, let come in another way, to itself in itself
make something happen to language, something so intimate it would no longer be in the position to protest without having to protest: speak in HIS language
is language not born of vindictive jealous?
Derrida’s an incomprehensible guest in French language
“incarnate archive of a liturgy whose secret no one will betray,” no one else could appropriate, even I, who is in on the secret
Derrida experienced catastrophe as a paradoxical opportunity: bottomless alienation of the soul
insidious Christian contamination: the respectful belief in inwardness, the preference for intention, the heart, the mind, mistrust of action given to the mechanicity of the body, against Pharisaism
one would have to invent oneself
relentless resistance to translation untranslatable: poetic ECONOMY of the idiom (singular event of the original). From the moment economic equivalence is renounced everything is translatable.
vision of the New International w/ every word
both at same time: 2 hyperboles, everything can and cannot be translated, “it is easy for me to hold firm between these two hyperboles”
write without itinerary, or map
necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself

break with tradition, uprooting, amnesia w/out recourse: all of these unleash the genealogical drive, the desire of the idiom, impulse to anamnesis, destructive love of the interdict, tattooing of all colors on the body [see AF p. 10 erogenous color draws mask]
madness of a hypermnesia, a supplement of loyalty, commit to traces of writing: toward an anamnesis of the entirely other > this is the most difficult thing [Aristotle says same about virtue]
deconstruction as debate with monolingualism of the other and its words: truth, alienation, appropriation, habitation, chez-soi, ipseity, place of subject, law

the monolingual is promised (an eschatological or messianic horizon this promise can’t deny, or can merely deny) one language that’s forever deprived, the monolingual is aphasic, thrown into absolute translation
political decision in writing & reading: inscribe undecidable (chance, terror) in ipseity of host, avoid temptation to make prior-to-the-first-language a language of the master (new master)
language of the other, promised language [which doesn’t exist], entirely other [tout autre] than language of the other as language of colonist > there are unsettling resemblances
desire is borne by the arrival itself, before ipseity (I-me)
what is the avowal, error, or defect, from which one must write?
languages w/out itinerary that can’t arrive
monolingual (promised one language, deprived of it) writes as an aphasic: absolute translation
translate memory of what was forbidden, did not take place, left a [hardly legible] trace, mark, scar
there are 2 others: 1) language of the other as promised sentence 2) language of other as that of master or colonist; both have unsettling resemblances kept secret, held in reserve
liberal policing
prosthesis of origin: prior-to-the-first time of pre-originary language, must be invented

always easier to bless my destiny, I write blindly, using machines, seeking to touch the one to thank for the gift of language > day I knew to whom to render thanks, I would know everything, I could die
identify in order to combat: impulses, phantasms, “ideologies” “fetishizations,” and symbolics of appropriation
entirely other prior-to-the-first language, zone outside law, degree zero-minus-one of writing, leaves a phantomatical map

Derrida dreams of leaving marks that recall the entirely other prior-to-the-first language: degree zero-minus-one of memory, a desire for infinite salvation: scratch and graft, caress with claws, borrowed [see DEBT] claws
promise is not nothing, not a non-event
most authoritarian cultural clichés = indefatigable generation of the literary superego
fatal precipitation of promise dissociated from will, intention, meaning-to-say [vouloir-dire], heralds uniqueness of language to came, “there is…” implies “it doesn’t exist”
[compare Lacan’s Y a d’ l’Un to Derrida’s “there is some language”]
appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together in advance, not in unity, identity, but in singularity of its difference to itself: in difference avec soi not d’avec soi
[gift] remains only on this condition: still remaining to be given
gift of language remains only on condition that it still remains to be given
do I write in the promise of a sole poem, still unheard-of language? each time I speak or write, I promise

promise [of which I speak], promises the impossible, possibility of all speech, yields no messianic, eschatological content [saves nothing]; yet resembles messianism, soteriology [addressed to totally other, finite mortal, w/out hope], structural opening: messianism w/out messianicity
other is entirely other when knowledge and recognition does not suffice for it
messianicity w/out messianism: promise w/out content, or is all messianism shorn and severe? let us never rule it out!
Heidegger says [?], “there is language that does not exist,” i.e. there is no metalanguage
universal structure: messianic idiom
universal structure: messianic idiom
universal structure: messianic idiom
phallogocentrism, Western metaphysics > not a single homogenous thing
in the waiting without horizon for a language that only knows how to keep people waiting

[Derrida’s quilting point?] passage points = places of transcendence, absolute elsewhere in eyes of Greco-Latino-Christian philosophy & yet inside it > epekeina tes ousias, khōra, negative theology, Freud, Artaud, Blanchot, Levinas, Eckhart
Derrida has the illusion he cultivates his own desert, whereas a hostage’s place was reserved for him, as a summons (mise en demeure)
still readable secrets of unreadability
let all my specters loose, a desire w/out horizon
“I finally know how not to distinguish between promise and terror”
“to-come” gestures toward invention, invention not of the event but through it
for Heidegger, Zusage primary to question, the most irreducible in thought
